response: "Why do I feel like I have to be perfect all the time? It's exhausting."
"I can't keep up with the expectations of society. It's driving me crazy."
"I don't even know who I am anymore. I'm just trying to fit into this perfect mold."
"Why do I have to be thin, have flawless skin, and always look put together to be considered beautiful?"
"I feel like I'm drowning in a sea of expectations. I just want to be me."
"I know deep down that perfection doesn't exist, but I still feel like I have to strive for it."
"It's hard not to compare myself to others who seem perfect. But I know it's not healthy."
"I'm tired of feeling like I'm not good enough. When will society realize that perfection is impossible?"
"I wish I could just be accepted for who I am, flaws and all."
"I need to remind myself that my worth is not tied to my appearance or achievements. It's okay to be imperfect."
